short_summary: Junior Non-Commissioned Members Training Accommodation Facility
description: The government of Canada is seeking to build a new multi-story accommodation facility for the training of junior non-commissioned members at the Naden site of Canadian Forces Base Esquimalt. The facility will provide single occupancy bedrooms, kitchen and dining facilities, junior non-commissioned member mess, flexible training spaces, administrative areas and associated auxiliary functions. The project includes the demolition of existing NAD34 (Nelle’s Block) building. The estimated value of the contract is between $145M - $165M.

## Junior Non-Commissioned Members Training Accommodation Facility Advance Procurement Notice
**Reference Number**: MX-42944732452
**Publication Date**: November 16, 2023
**Tender Closing Date**: January 9, 2024 5:00 PM EST

### Tender Description
This Advance Procurement Notice (APN) serves as a notification of a potential contract with security requirements to provide interested consultants and contractors an opportunity to initiate the sponsorship request process for obtaining the required security clearance(s). The APN does not guarantee that the contract will proceed or that any security clearance(s) will be granted in a timely manner.

### Project Description and Services
The Ministry of National Defence is seeking a consultant or contractor to design and construct a new Junior Non-Commissioned Members Training Accommodation Facility at the Naden site of the Canadian Forces Base Esquimalt. The facility will include single occupancy bedrooms, kitchen and dining facilities, junior non-commissioned member mess, flexible breakout training spaces, administrative areas, and auxiliary functions. The project will be designed to achieve a Green Building Certification and be Net Zero Carbon compliant.

### Contract Requirements
To be eligible for contract award, the consultant or contractor must:

* Hold the required Designated Organization Screening (DOS) clearance at the time of closing
* Actively participate in the sponsorship request process through Defence Construction Canada's Industrial Security Program (ISP)
* Cooperate with the Contract Security Program (CSP) to process security clearance requests

### Security Clearance Requirements
The required security clearance(s) for this project are:

* Designated Organization Screening (DOS) clearance granted or approved by the CSP, Public Works and Government Services Canada

### Posting and Requirements
The tender documents are available on the Merx website. Interested consultants and contractors are required to:

* Contact Defence Construction Canada to initiate the sponsorship request process
* Register and obtain a Sponsorship Request Number
* Attend an Information Session (if required)

### Contact Information
For any questions regarding the sponsorship request process, please contact:

* Defence Construction Canada: (613) 998-8974 or ISP.Sponsorship@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

For any questions regarding the APN, please contact:

* Danielle Flynn, Coordinator, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada: 778-789-3070 or danielle.flynn@dcc-cdc.gc.ca
